      public Player(Integer health, Integer power)

  • Method Details

    • getInventory

      public Structures.ArrayStack<UsableAbstractItem> getInventory()
      Retrieves the player's inventory.
      Returns:
      An ArrayStack containing the UsableAbstractItems in the player's inventory.

    • getItemCount

      public Integer getItemCount()
      Retrieves the number of items currently in the player's inventory.
      Returns:
      An Integer representing the count of UsableAbstractItems in the inventory.

    • setInventory

      public void setInventory(Structures.ArrayStack<UsableAbstractItem> inventory)
      Sets the player's inventory to the given ArrayStack.

      If the given ArrayStack contains more than INVENTORY_SIZE items, an InventoryFullException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      inventory - The ArrayStack containing the UsableAbstractItems to set in the inventory.
      Throws:
      InventoryFullException - If the given ArrayStack contains more than INVENTORY_SIZE items.

    • addItem

      public boolean addItem(UsableAbstractItem item)
      Adds the given UsableAbstractItem to the player's inventory.

      If the item is a VestItem, it is used immediately.

      If the inventory is not full, the item is added to it.

      If the inventory is full, the method returns false.

      Parameters:
      item - The UsableAbstractItem to add to the inventory.
      Returns:
      true if the item was added to the inventory, false otherwise.

    • useItem

      public boolean useItem()
      Tries to use an item from the player's inventory.

      If the inventory is empty, the method prints an error message and returns false.

      If the item is null, an ItemNullException is thrown.

      Otherwise, the item is used on the player and the method returns true.

      Returns:
      true if an item was used, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      ItemNullException - If the item is null.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(Division division)
      Tries to move the player to the given division.

      If the player is already in the given division, the method prints an error message and returns.

      If the given division is null, the method prints an error message and returns.

      If the given division is not a neighbour of the player's current division, the method prints an error message and returns.

      Otherwise, the player is moved to the given division, the division is added to the player's path and the method calls checkRoomForItems().

      Parameters:
      division - The division to move the player to.

    • getBackPathSize

      public int getBackPathSize()
      Retrieves the size of the player's back path.

      This method returns the number of divisions in the player's path stack, representing the count of places the player has visited.

      Returns:
      An integer representing the size of the back path.

    • getPath

      public Structures.ArrayStack<Division> getPath()
      Retrieves the player's back path.

      This method returns the ArrayStack containing the Divisions the player has visited.

      The back path is a stack of divisions, where the top element is the most recent division visited.

      The ArrayStack is a copy of the player's internal path stack.

      Returns:
      An ArrayStack containing the player's back path.

    • moveBack

      public void moveBack()
      Moves the player back to the previously visited division.

      This method attempts to pop the most recent division from the player's path stack and move the player to that division.

      If the path stack is empty, indicating there are no previous divisions to return to, an error message is printed.

    • getActionsHistory

      public Structures.LinkedQueue<String> getActionsHistory()
      Retrieves the player's action history.

      This method returns the LinkedQueue containing the player's action history.

      The action history is a queue of strings, where each string represents an action performed by the player. The most recent action is at the front of the queue.

      Returns:
      A LinkedQueue containing the player's action history.

    • getLastPlaceVisited

      public Division getLastPlaceVisited() throws Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
      Retrieves the last division the player visited.

      This method peeks at the top element of the player's path stack, which is the most recent division the player visited.

      If the path stack is empty, an EmptyCollectionException is thrown.

      Returns:
      The last division the player visited.
      Throws:
      Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException - If the path stack is empty.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks if the player is in a valid state.

      Checks if the player's health is above 0 and if the player's power is above 0. If the player is in an invalid state, an InvalidPlayerException is thrown.

      Returns:
      true if the player is valid, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      InvalidPlayerException - If the player is not valid.

    • getTag

      public String getTag()
      Retrieves the player's tag.

      The player's tag is a string in the format [name - health ♥], where name is the player's name and health is the player's current health.

      If the player's health is greater than 100, a star (✿) is added after the heart (♥) symbol, indicating that the player has a shield.

      This method is overridden from the superclass.

      Overrides:
      getTag in class Entity
      Returns:
      The player's tag.
